creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
description: Louis-Philippe, King of the French, Ferdinand Philippe Louis Charles Henri, Duc d'Orléans, and Louis Charles Philippe Raphaël d'Orléans, Duc de Némours.
text: Louis Philippe became King of France following the Revolution of 1830. He was dethroned during the international uprisings of 1848, which caused widespread social disruptions.
title: Louis Philippe (1773–1850), King of France, and his Sons, the Duke of Chartres and the Duke of Nemours
